title: Proper Food Storage: Maximize Freshness
description: Store herbs like flowers in water, keep potatoes in dark cool places, and never refrigerate tomatoes, onions, or garlic. Understanding proper storage extends ingredient life significantly.

title: Salt Timing: When and How Much
description: Learn the crucial timing of salting different ingredients. Salt vegetables 40 minutes before cooking to draw out moisture, but salt meat just before cooking to prevent moisture loss.

title: The Science of Perfect Bread Dough
description: Understand gluten development through proper kneading technique. The windowpane test reveals when dough is ready - stretch a small piece until translucent without tearing.

title: Emulsification Mastery: Perfect Sauces
description: Create silky smooth emulsions by slowly whisking oil into egg yolks at room temperature. The key is adding fat drop by drop initially, then in a thin stream once the emulsion begins.

title: Perfect Knife Grip for Precision Cuts
description: Master the pinch grip technique to improve your cutting accuracy and speed. Hold the knife handle with three fingers while pinching the blade with your thumb and index finger just above the bolster.

title: The Perfect Sear: High Heat Secrets
description: Achieve restaurant-quality sears by ensuring your pan is smoking hot before adding oil, then protein. Never move the food until a proper crust forms - patience is key.
